teams.ucmTeam
Class Behaviour

java.lang.Object
  teams.ucmTeam.Behaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public abstract class Behaviour
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

The interface that represents a robot behaviour. A robot behaviour has a reference to the robot that it controls and a queue with the messages sent to the robot.

Robot behaviours are interchangeables during the execution of a match. The lifecycle of a behaviour is the following one:

  • When the TeamManager is configured, the behaviours execute the configure method. The robotAPI is not available when executing this method.
  • When the behaviour is attached to a robot, it executes the init method. This method can be invoked more than once during the match.
  • When the behaviour is attached, the takeStep method is invoked on each frame time
  • When the behaviour is dettached from the robot, it executes the release method. This method can be invoked more than once during the match.
  • When the match has finished, it executes the end method

Subclasses must implement the following methods:

  • configure()
  • onInit(RobotAPI): invoked by init method
  • takeStep()
  • onRelease(RobotAPI): invoked by release method
  • end()

Author:
GAIA (UCM)
